artifact_name: cup type a(possibly); cup type c(possibly)
Description: Body sherd of Attic Silhouette pottery type A or type C cup; interior glazed black; exterior: painted decoration consisting of lower part of leg of male figure or satyr and two legs of animal or bird, to right; at far right, vine; below, dilute band.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0638) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
